episodeTitle: The Silent Assault!! The Mysterious Visitor, 'Tyrant' Kuma
description: Nami pursues Perona to recover stolen treasure, but encounters the fearsome Warlord Bartholomew Kuma at the Thousand Sunny. Meanwhile, the Straw Hats exploit Oars' vulnerability to Luffy's weaknesses in their ongoing battle, while Luffy discovers he's been chasing only Moria's shadow.

events.title: Nami Defeats Twin Squirrel Zombies
events.description: The episode opens with twin squirrel zombies encountering Nami, who aggressively pursues them for taking her treasure. She quickly defeats them with her Clima-Tact abilities.
events.significance: Demonstrates Nami's determination to recover the stolen treasure and sets up her pursuit of Perona.

events.title: Nami Heads to the Thousand Sunny
events.description: After defeating the squirrel zombies, Nami heads toward the Thousand Sunny via Franky's bridge to confront Perona and recover the stolen treasure.
events.significance: Sets up Nami's encounter with Bartholomew Kuma at the ship.

events.title: Oars Trapped by His Horns
events.description: Oars remains stuck with his horns embedded deep into the ground. The Straw Hats celebrate this temporary advantage, with Robin displaying a notably menacing expression of satisfaction.
events.significance: Provides the Straw Hats with a crucial tactical advantage against the seemingly unstoppable giant zombie.

events.title: Oars Frees Himself and Attacks
events.description: Oars successfully pulls his horns free from the ground and becomes increasingly enraged at the Straw Hats. The crew must now face him at full strength without the advantage of him being immobilized.
events.significance: Escalates the battle against Oars, forcing the Straw Hats to employ more creative tactics.

events.title: Pirates Docking 3 Formation
events.description: Unable to get Robin, Zoro, and Sanji to participate in the full Pirates Docking 6 again, Franky combines with just Usopp and Chopper to form Pirates Docking 3. With Sanji's help propelling them, they mount an attack on Oars' head using a stomping technique.
events.significance: An anime-exclusive comedic moment showcasing the crew's creative but ineffective attempts to damage Oars. Robin's refusal continues the running gag.

events.title: Exploiting Oars' Luffy-Like Weaknesses
events.description: Usopp realizes that since Oars has Luffy's shadow, he also shares Luffy's personality traits and weaknesses. The crew begins using meat as bait to distract Oars, allowing them to attack his vulnerable points like his knees.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Straw Hats' strategic thinking and their deep understanding of Luffy's character, turning it into a tactical advantage.

events.title: Zoro Tests His New Sword from Ryuma
events.description: Zoro decides to test Shusui, the legendary sword he acquired after defeating Ryuma. He uses it in combat against Oars, demonstrating the blade's quality and power.
events.significance: First combat use of Shusui in battle, marking Zoro's acquisition of one of his most important weapons.

events.title: Bartholomew Kuma Appears at the Thousand Sunny
events.description: A tall, imposing figure appears behind Perona at the Thousand Sunny. She is shocked and terrified to see Bartholomew Kuma, one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea, equal in rank to Gecko Moria.
events.significance: Marks Kuma's dramatic entrance at Thriller Bark, introducing a new level of threat and mystery to the arc. His presence foreshadows major events to come.

events.title: Perona's Warning About Kuma
events.description: Perona's zombie subordinates warn her about vanished companions. She initially dismisses the threat, but quickly realizes the danger when she learns this stranger is Bartholomew Kuma, a Warlord of the Sea.
events.significance: Establishes Kuma's fearsome reputation and the terror he inspires even among Moria's forces.

events.title: Kuma Demonstrates the Nikyu Nikyu no Mi
events.description: Perona launches her 'ultimate combo' attack against Kuma, but he calmly removes his glove, revealing paw pads on his palm. Using the power of the Nikyu Nikyu no Mi (Paw-Paw Fruit), he causes Perona to vanish instantly with a single touch.
events.significance: First demonstration of Kuma's Devil Fruit abilities at Thriller Bark, showcasing his overwhelming power. The instant defeat of Perona, who had been a formidable opponent, establishes Kuma as an elite-level threat.

events.title: Nami Arrives and Encounters Kuma
events.description: Nami arrives at the Thousand Sunny expecting to confront Perona, only to find the mysterious and intimidating Bartholomew Kuma instead. She is immediately on guard, sensing the danger.
events.significance: Places Nami in direct contact with one of the World Government's most powerful agents, creating a tense confrontation.

events.title: Kuma Asks About Luffy's Brother
events.description: In a cryptic and unexpected question, Kuma asks Nami if Monkey D. Luffy has a brother, specifically inquiring about Ace. After confirming Nami is a member of the Straw Hat crew, he vanishes without explanation.
events.significance: Reveals that the World Government, through Kuma, has knowledge of or interest in Luffy's connection to Ace. This foreshadows future events and raises questions about Kuma's true motives.

events.title: Luffy Discovers He's Chasing Moria's Shadow
events.description: Luffy, who has been pursuing what he believed was Gecko Moria through the forest, finally catches up and uses his Gum-Gum Rocket technique. However, he discovers to his frustration that he's actually captured Moria's shadow rather than Moria himself, revealing that Moria has been deceiving him.
events.significance: Shows Moria's cunning tactics and ability to manipulate his shadow for deception. Luffy's realization that he's been tricked adds to his frustration and determination.

events.title: Pandaman Easter Egg
events.description: Pandaman, Oda's signature recurring background character, makes a cameo appearance in this episode. Additionally, Franky's signature 'F' mark is visible on a makeshift structure at this timestamp.
events.significance: A fun Easter egg for attentive fans, maintaining the series' tradition of hidden Pandaman appearances throughout the anime.

quotes.text: If Monkey D. Luffy has a brother...
quotes.speaker: Bartholomew Kuma
quotes.context: Kuma cryptically questions Nami about Ace, revealing the World Government's knowledge of Luffy's connections

themes.theme: The Unpredictability of Allies and Enemies
themes.description: Kuma's appearance raises questions about his true allegiance. While officially a World Government agent, his actions and questions suggest hidden motives.
themes.symbolism: Kuma's silent, methodical approach and cryptic questions symbolize the mysterious nature of power in the One Piece world.

themes.description: The Straw Hats' ability to exploit Oars' Luffy-like personality demonstrates their deep understanding of their captain and their ability to turn even personality quirks into strategic advantages.
themes.symbolism: Using meat to distract Oars symbolizes how the crew's intimate knowledge of each other's weaknesses can be turned into strengths.

themes.description: Just as the Straw Hats seem to be gaining an advantage against Oars and Moria, the arrival of an even more powerful Warlord reminds them that the world is full of overwhelming challenges.
themes.symbolism: Kuma's effortless defeat of Perona represents the vast power gap the Straw Hats still need to overcome.

characterSpotlights.development: Kuma's arrival at Thriller Bark establishes him as an enigmatic and overwhelmingly powerful figure. His question about Ace and his calm demeanor create intrigue about his true intentions.
keyActions: Effortlessly defeats Perona with Nikyu Nikyu no Mi
Questions Nami about Luffy's brother Ace
Vanishes mysteriously after getting his answer
quotes: If Monkey D. Luffy has a brother...

characterSpotlights.development: Nami demonstrates her determination to recover the treasure, but finds herself in a dangerous situation when confronting Kuma. Her encounter with him provides crucial information about Ace.
keyActions: Pursues Perona to the Thousand Sunny
Answers Kuma's questions about Luffy and Ace

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp demonstrates his tactical intelligence by recognizing that Oars shares Luffy's weaknesses and personality traits, allowing the crew to exploit this knowledge.
keyActions: Realizes Oars has Luffy's personality weaknesses
Develops strategy to use meat as bait
Helps coordinate attacks on Oars' vulnerable points

characterSpotlights.development: After being a formidable opponent to the Straw Hats, Perona is instantly and effortlessly defeated by Kuma, establishing the vast power difference between mid-level and top-tier threats.
keyActions: Attempts to escape Thriller Bark with treasure
Launches ultimate combo attack against Kuma
Is instantly vanished by Kuma's powers

mangaDifferences.difference: Pirates Docking 3 is an anime-exclusive technique. In the manga, the crew attempts other tactics against Oars without this specific combination attack.

trivia.fact: Episode 368 adapts Chapter 473 of the manga, titled 'Warlord Bartholomew Kuma Appears'.
This episode marks Bartholomew Kuma's first appearance at Thriller Bark, setting up one of the arc's most memorable moments in future episodes.
Pandaman makes a cameo appearance at approximately 6:46 in the episode, continuing Eiichiro Oda's tradition of hiding this character throughout the series.
The Nikyu Nikyu no Mi (Paw-Paw Fruit) is one of the most versatile Paramecia-type Devil Fruits, capable of repelling both physical objects and intangible concepts like pain and memories.

sources.title: One Piece: Kuma's Nikyu Nikyu no Mi Has Key Strengths & Weaknesses

trivia.fact: Hideyuki Hori, Kuma's Japanese voice actor, brings a calm yet menacing tone to the character that perfectly matches his mysterious nature.

sources.title: Bartholomew Kuma Voice - One Piece (TV Show)
